reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned from a pleasant one week stay at Pollux end of last week. The hotel is a comfortable, no frills hotel on the main street in Zermatt. The rooms are of good size and the beds are comfortable. We were in a standard room while a friend was in a room with french balcony. Both are very similar in size and comfort, and I would not hesitate booking one as a double for a future stay. We were in room 204, which was nice and toward the garden side, however, one in our group who was on the street side was not bothered by any noise as is mentioned in previous reviews. The bathrooms are a bit small but otherwise adequate and well equipped.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay

reviews.text: The staff were always helpful with any of our queries, from directions to dinner reservations, they made the effort to accommodate and deliver on our request. At breakfast, as they had no low fat milk of yogurt on offer, the staff took ordered enough for the rest of our stay. The breakfast had a good choice of breads, ham, cheese, fruits cereals and juices. We had dinner at the restaurant on three occasions and the food was good although the service was just a bit slow.
reviews.title: WINTER PARADISE

reviews.text: Zermatt is a cozy little town, so literally any location is within 15 minutes walking distance. In the mornings, we usually took an electric taxi to get to the ski lifts even though the Gornergrat rail station was only a very short walk down the road. Sunnega is about a ten minute walk while Klein Matterhorn is a little further away. Skiing is great and suited for all levels of skier and the whole domain is accessible to intermediate level skiers. There are several very long and scenic runs.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: We will certainly return to Zermatt, and although we usually like to try different hotels, we will likely book pollux again. It was really just what we needed in a hotel, a relaxing comfortable stay without overdoing it and very good value for money for a ski holiday in a top resort.
reviews.title: Warm welcome and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Zermatt with family and friends. Four families, we rented Pollux and twin chalet Castor. Both chalets accommodated 9 people each.
reviews.title: Great View from our room--don't miss Zermatt

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights while on a tour. My front room, which was compact but clean and well appointed, had a nice view and was not overly noisy even with the windows open at night. The Disco noise was not an issue, perhaps it was closed. Location was great, although the town is pretty tiny, and you are usually within five minutes walk of everyting. Breakfast was good, the one dinner I had there was OK. Staff was friendly. I'd definately stay again.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Zermatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very Nice comfortable hotel downtown, close to everything; groceries, other restaurants. Nice rooms, good breakfast. Very friendly and helpful staff and owner. Enjoyed our stay very much. Good food in their restaurant.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Great Hotel to come back to after a day of skiing! We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and booked a family room for myself and 12yr old daughter and 18yr old son, away from the sound of the disco (thanks for that advice). We had a family room on the top floor at the back of the hotel. From the balcony we could see the Matterhorn which was an added bonus. The rooms were a good size, nice living area and my son had his own bedroom and ensuite and TV. The rooms were cleaned every day and our beds turned down every night! not sure we liked that very much as our PJs were arranged in different positions each night, but it made us laugh when we actually arranged them ourselves before we went out to give the maid a little giggle! The cosy bar with a roaring fireplace was great for a drink in the evening and the restaurant was always accommdating with great food, I think we ate there twice. If we ever go to Zermatt again we will definately stay at the Pollux, central to everything and only a short walk from the Sunnega ski lifts, the breakfast buffet also was lovely, friendly service, and very attentive. Loved it.
reviews.title: Just Perfect!!

reviews.text: Although we didn't stay here, we has the most wonderful evening here. After a bad experience in a restaurant up the road, we came here hoping for a better service and boy thats what we got. Greeted with a smile and fabulous service throughout, alongside fantastic food and a lovely relaxed atmosphere- we were not disappointed!! The star of the show certainly was Nadine, who is a true credit to the place- fantastic at her job and just a lovely girl, thanks guys we had a great night!
reviews.title: Fabulous atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice cozy hotel and just 4-5 mins from the rail station. Zermatt is a no car zone so it was easy to get to the hotel. Very helpful staff and a really decent room size.
reviews.title: Nice Comfortable Hotel
Great place in town centre with a really cosy bar
reviews.text: We stayed for 14 nights at the Pollux, having stayed there before, and found it to be of a generally very good standard. The two best points about this hotel are its central location and its cosy bar with open fire. This bar is a lovely spot for an evening drink, a tea or coffee, or glass of wine. The waitresses are friendly and efficient and the service quite quick. The owner is also hospitable and welcoming.
The hotel provides good comfortable rooms at a reasonable price (for Zermatt) and a good buffet breakfast. It has two restaurants serving Swiss food, but we always ate out so cannot comment.
reviews.title: Great Zermatt hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room itself was a double aspect street view, which enabled us to see what was going on up and down the Bahnhofstrasse. However, the only downside to this was some street noise from “youth” leaving clubs in the early hours, after which they decided to shout and sing and so on, just outside the hotel. This went on until 4 or 5 am.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the Center of Zermatt

reviews.text: At this price-point I believe this is one of the best hotels in town and perfectly good for a skiing holiday where you are out most of the days. If I wasn’t skiing I might choose somewhere with larger public rooms.
reviews.title: Great hotel in the heart of Zermatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would certainly come back when skiing in Zermatt. However, I would add that this is unlikely to be over Christmas again, as the town is extended far beyond it capacity by the number of visitors at this time. Crowded ski-pistes, lift lines and difficulty getting reservations for restaurants are all downsides of Zermatt at Christmas. I would recommend visiting in a late January quiet week.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great resort town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a lovely, modern hotel. We paid for an upgraded room and were glad we did as we were give one on the top (4th floor although there are 2 rooms on the 5th floor). We booked on the hotel website and it was only about 15 or 20 CFH/night for the better room.
reviews.title: View of Matterhorn from our room! Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was the corner room #401 and it was perfect! We had a balcony facing the main road but as it was in between seasons (first days of May) it was not noisy. The best thing about the room was that it had windows and skylights facing the Matterhorn so we had an amazing view from our room! Also the windows & skylight had automatic drapes controlled by remote so they were easily adjustable. The room had a safe, refrigerator, flat screen tv, nice sitting area with sofa, table and chairs as well as a chair on the balcony. The bathroom was nice and the entire room was very spacious.
reviews.title: Great rooms, convenient location, overall wonderful experience

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was ideal. It was right in the center of town a short walk from the train station so no electronic-taxis needed. When you arrive at the train station, take a right and head right up the main road towards the Matterhorn and the hotel will be on your right hand side less than 1 block away.
reviews.title: Great views, cozy, what you want from a hotel in the alps

reviews.text: The hotel had great service (let us check in early and borrow a cork screw from the bar). The complementary breakfast was also very nice.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location, excellent service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we return to Zermatt we would definitely stay at this hotel again!
reviews.title: Good Hotel With Good Location But Expensive
